description: Borrowed from Spanish mezquite, mizquite, from Nahuatl mizquitl (“mesquite tree”).

entries.meaning: Any of several deciduous trees of the genus Prosopis found in America, and used as forage, which have long, beige seed/bean pods which may be dried and ground into a sweet, nutty flour.
The wood of these trees, used for smoking food, or charcoal made from this wood.
Country or land dominated by mesquite trees.
